content.rendered:
Whitney and Ryan were married in serious style with a modern romantic wedding at The Bridge Building.

This lovely couple met in Panama City while separately vacationing for a senior trip. Ryan later proposed at the Botanical Gardens in St Louis, Missouri. How sweet!

For the wedding day, Whitney and Ryan chose navy and dusty rose tones with soft touches of greenery and modern decor. A geometric arch from LMA Designs stood as a backdrop to their simple ceremony on the rooftop. For the reception, whimsical arrangements created by LMA added a natural vibe to the space.

Before the ceremony, Whitney shared the sweetest first look with both her dad and Ryan. To them, it was their most memorable part of the whole day.

When the time came to say, "I do," Whitney followed behind the couple's most precious pup with her dad by her side. Not to mention, Whitney's brother actually officiated the ceremony.

After the vows, guests made their way downstairs to share a sip or two and a yummy bite to eat. Their plated dinners consisted of lemon and herb baked chicken, grilled asparagus, and buttermilk whipped potatoes or herb-roasted pork loin, grilled asparagus, and lemon roasted fingerling potatoes.

Following a yummy meal and a sweet cake from Publix, Whitney and Ryan shared a first dance to "I’ll Be" by Edwin McCain.

Keep scrolling for some major modern romantic wedding day inspiration.

WEDDING DETAILS

Date: July 13, 2019
Bride & Groom: Whitney and Ryan
Location: The Bridge Building
Guest Count: 194
Colors: Dusty Rose & Navy
Photographer: Abbey Hunter
Florist: LMA Designs
Cake: Publix
Linens: Music City Tents
DJ: 8 South Band
Catering & Bar: The Bridge Building
Production Design: Nashville Lighting & Production
Planning: Sarah & Emily | IH

excerpt.rendered: A simple modern wedding ceremony and reception at The Bridge Building with romantic details.
